definition: to smear one's lips with the blood of a sacrifice as a means of pledging allegiance (old)
to smear the lips with blood when taking an oath (idiom)/to swear a sacred oath

sentences.english: But it’s a special request, which is like some kind of blood oath.
sentences.chinese: 但这是一个特别的要求，有点像歃血为盟。

sentences.english: This boy is this generation Sha the blood believes in of outstanding pupil?
sentences.chinese: 难道这小子是这一代歃血宗的杰出弟子？

definition: to smear the lips with blood when taking an oath (idiom)/to swear a sacred oath
contract of alliance/oath or treaty between allies
to rip one's robe as a sign of repudiating a sworn brotherhood (idiom)/to break all friendly ties
meetings conducted by rulers in feudal China for the purpose of formalizing alliances, finalizing treaties
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
to meet as volunteers for an uprising
to become sworn brothers or sisters/sworn (brothers)
